front.title: Techniques for Tracking Inventory Using DHCPv6 DUID

abstract.t: In the years since DHCPv4 gained widespread popularity, one of the uses to which organizations have put it is inventory tracking: associating identifiers scanned from packaging with records in an inventory database. This document describes various means for accomplishing the same purpose using DHCPv6. This document also updates RFC3315 by clarifying the meaning of some normative language regarding the DUID-LL and DUID-LLT DUID types.
